text: PROLOGUE
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: In the first place please bear in mind that I do not expect you to
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: believe this story.  Nor could you wonder had you witnessed a recent
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: experience of mine when, in the armor of blissful and stupendous
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ignorance, I gaily narrated the gist of it to a Fellow of the Royal
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Geological Society on the occasion of my last trip to London.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: You would surely have thought that I had been detected in no less a
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: heinous crime than the purloining of the Crown Jewels from the Tower,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: or putting poison in the coffee of His Majesty the King.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The erudite gentleman in whom I confided congealed before I was half
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: through!--it is all that saved him from exploding--and my dreams of an
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Honorary Fellowship, gold medals, and a niche in the Hall of Fame faded
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: into the thin, cold air of his arctic atmosphere.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: But I believe the story, and so would you, and so would the learned
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Fellow of the Royal Geological Society, had you and he heard it from
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the lips of the man who told it to me.  Had you seen, as I did, the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fire of truth in those gray eyes; had you felt the ring of sincerity in
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that quiet voice; had you realized the pathos of it all--you, too,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: would believe.  You would not have needed the final ocular proof that I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had--the weird rhamphorhynchus-like creature which he had brought back
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with him from the inner world.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I came upon him quite suddenly, and no less unexpectedly, upon the rim
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the great Sahara Desert.  He was standing before a goat-skin tent
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: amidst a clump of date palms within a tiny oasis.  Close by was an Arab
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: douar of some eight or ten tents.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I had come down from the north to hunt lion.  My party consisted of a
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dozen children of the desert--I was the only "white" man.  As we
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: approached the little clump of verdure I saw the man come from his tent
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and with hand-shaded eyes peer intently at us.  At sight of me he
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: advanced rapidly to meet us.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "A white man!" he cried.  "May the good Lord be praised! I have been
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: watching you for hours, hoping against hope that THIS time there would
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: be a white man.  Tell me the date.  What year is it?"
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: And when I had told him he staggered as though he had been struck full
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in the face, so that he was compelled to grasp my stirrup leather for
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: support.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "It cannot be!" he cried after a moment.  "It cannot be!  Tell me that
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: you are mistaken, or that you are but joking."
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I am telling you the truth, my friend," I replied.  "Why should I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: deceive a stranger, or attempt to, in so simple a matter as the date?"
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: For some time he stood in silence, with bowed head.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Ten years!" he murmured, at last.  "Ten years, and I thought that at
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the most it could be scarce more than one!" That night he told me his
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: story--the story that I give you here as nearly in his own words as I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: can recall them.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: TOWARD THE ETERNAL FIRES
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I was born in Connecticut about thirty years ago.  My name is David
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Innes.  My father was a wealthy mine owner.  When I was nineteen he
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: died.  All his property was to be mine when I had attained my
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: majority--provided that I had devoted the two years intervening in
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: close application to the great business I was to inherit.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I did my best to fulfil the last wishes of my parent--not because of
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the inheritance, but because I loved and honored my father.  For six
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: months I toiled in the mines and in the counting-rooms, for I wished to
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: know every minute detail of the business.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Then Perry interested me in his invention.  He was an old fellow who
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had devoted the better part of a long life to the perfection of a
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mechanical subterranean prospector.  As relaxation he studied
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: paleontology.  I looked over his plans, listened to his arguments,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: inspected his working model--and then, convinced, I advanced the funds
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: necessary to construct a full-sized, practical prospector.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I shall not go into the details of its construction--it lies out there
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in the desert now--about two miles from here.  Tomorrow you may care to
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ride out and see it.  Roughly, it is a steel cylinder a hundred feet
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: long, and jointed so that it may turn and twist through solid rock if
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: need be.  At one end is a mighty revolving drill operated by an engine
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which Perry said generated more power to the cubic inch than any other
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: engine did to the cubic foot.  I remember that he used to claim that
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that invention alone would make us fabulously wealthy--we were going to
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: make the whole thing public after the successful issue of our first
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: secret trial--but Perry never returned from that trial trip, and I only
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: after ten years.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I recall as it were but yesterday the night of that momentous occasion
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon which we were to test the practicality of that wondrous invention.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It was near midnight when we repaired to the lofty tower in which Perry
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had constructed his "iron mole" as he was wont to call the thing.  The
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: great nose rested upon the bare earth of the floor.  We passed through
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the doors into the outer jacket, secured them, and then passing on into
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the cabin, which contained the controlling mechanism within the inner
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: tube, switched on the electric lights.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Perry looked to his generator; to the great tanks that held the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: life-giving chemicals with which he was to manufacture fresh air to
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: replace that which we consumed in breathing; to his instruments for
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: recording temperatures, speed, distance, and for examining the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: materials through which we were to pass.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He tested the steering device, and overlooked the mighty cogs which
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: transmitted its marvelous velocity to the giant drill at the nose of
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: his strange craft.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Our seats, into which we strapped ourselves, were so arranged upon
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: transverse bars that we would be upright whether the craft were
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ploughing her way downward into the bowels of the earth, or running
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: horizontally along some great seam of coal, or rising vertically toward
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the surface again.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At length all was ready.  Perry bowed his head in prayer.  For a moment
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: we were silent, and then the old man's hand grasped the starting lever.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: There was a frightful roaring beneath us--the giant frame trembled and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: vibrated--there was a rush of sound as the loose earth passed up
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: through the hollow space between the inner and outer jackets to be
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: deposited in our wake.  We were off!
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The noise was deafening.  The sensation was frightful.  For a full
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: minute neither of us could do aught but cling with the proverbial
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: desperation of the drowning man to the handrails of our swinging seats.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Then Perry glanced at the thermometer.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Gad!" he cried, "it cannot be possible--quick!  What does the distance
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: meter read?"
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: That and the speedometer were both on my side of the cabin, and as I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: turned to take a reading from the former I could see Perry muttering.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Ten degrees rise--it cannot be possible!" and then I saw him tug
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: frantically upon the steering wheel.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As I finally found the tiny needle in the dim light I translated
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Perry's evident excitement, and my heart sank within me.  But when I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: spoke I hid the fear which haunted me.  "It will be seven hundred feet,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Perry," I said, "by the time you can turn her into the horizontal."
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "You'd better lend me a hand then, my boy," he replied, "for I cannot
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: budge her out of the vertical alone.  God give that our combined
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: strength may be equal to the task, for else we are lost."
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I wormed my way to the old man's side with never a doubt but that the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: great wheel would yield on the instant to the power of my young and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: vigorous muscles.  Nor was my belief mere vanity, for always had my
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: physique been the envy and despair of my fellows.  And for that very
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: reason it had waxed even greater than nature had intended, since my
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: natural pride in my great strength had led me to care for and develop
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my body and my muscles by every means within my power.  What with
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: boxing, football, and baseball, I had been in training since childhood.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: And so it was with the utmost confidence that I laid hold of the huge
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: iron rim; but though I threw every ounce of my strength into it, my
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: best effort was as unavailing as Perry's had been--the thing would not
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: budge--the grim, insensate, horrible thing that was holding us upon the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: straight road to death!
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At length I gave up the useless struggle, and without a word returned
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to my seat.  There was no need for words--at least none that I could
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: imagine, unless Perry desired to pray.  And I was quite sure that he
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: would, for he never left an opportunity neglected where he might
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sandwich in a prayer.  He prayed when he arose in the morning, he
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: prayed before he ate, he prayed when he had finished eating, and before
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: he went to bed at night he prayed again.  In between he often found
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: excuses to pray even when the provocation seemed far-fetched to my
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: worldly eyes--now that he was about to die I felt positive that I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: should witness a perfect orgy of prayer--if one may allude with such a
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: simile to so solemn an act.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: But to my astonishment I discovered that with death staring him in the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: face Abner Perry was transformed into a new being.  From his lips there
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: flowed--not prayer--but a clear and limpid stream of undiluted
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: profanity, and it was all directed at that quietly stubborn piece of
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: unyielding mechanism.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I should think, Perry," I chided, "that a man of your professed
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: religiousness would rather be at his prayers than cursing in the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: presence of imminent death."
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Death!" he cried.  "Death is it that appalls you?  That is nothing by
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: comparison with the loss the world must suffer.  Why, David within this
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: iron cylinder we have demonstrated possibilities that science has
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: scarce dreamed.  We have harnessed a new principle, and with it
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: animated a piece of steel with the power of ten thousand men.  That two
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lives will be snuffed out is nothing to the world calamity that entombs
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in the bowels of the earth the discoveries that I have made and proved
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in the successful construction of the thing that is now carrying us
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: farther and farther toward the eternal central fires."
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I am frank to admit that for myself I was much more concerned with our
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: own immediate future than with any problematic loss which the world
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: might be about to suffer.  The world was at least ignorant of its
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: bereavement, while to me it was a real and terrible actuality.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "What can we do?" I asked, hiding my perturbation beneath the mask of a
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: low and level voice.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "We may stop here, and die of asphyxiation when our atmosphere tanks
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: are empty," replied Perry, "or we may continue on with the slight hope
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that we may later sufficiently deflect the prospector from the vertical
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to carry us along the arc of a great circle which must eventually
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: return us to the surface.  If we succeed in so doing before we reach
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the higher internal temperature we may even yet survive.  There would
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: seem to me to be about one chance in several million that we shall
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: succeed--otherwise we shall die more quickly but no more surely than as
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: though we sat supinely waiting for the torture of a slow and horrible
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: death."
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I glanced at the thermometer.  It registered 110 degrees.  While we
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were talking the mighty iron mole had bored its way over a mile into
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the rock of the earth's crust.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Let us continue on, then," I replied.  "It should soon be over at this
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rate.  You never intimated that the speed of this thing would be so
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: high, Perry.  Didn't you know it?"
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "No," he answered.  "I could not figure the speed exactly, for I had no
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: instrument for measuring the mighty power of my generator.  I reasoned,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: however, that we should make about five hundred yards an hour."
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "And we are making seven miles an hour," I concluded for him, as I sat
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with my eyes upon the distance meter.  "How thick is the Earth's crust,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Perry?" I asked.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "There are almost as many conjectures as to that as there are
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: geologists," was his answer.  "One estimates it thirty miles, because
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the internal heat, increasing at the rate of about one degree to each
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sixty to seventy feet depth, would be sufficient to fuse the most
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: refractory substances at that distance beneath the surface.  Another
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: finds that the phenomena of precession and nutation require that the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: earth, if not entirely solid, must at least have a shell not less than
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: eight hundred to a thousand miles in thickness.  So there you are.  You
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: may take your choice."
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "And if it should prove solid?" I asked.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "It will be all the same to us in the end, David," replied Perry.  "At
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the best our fuel will suffice to carry us but three or four days,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: while our atmosphere cannot last to exceed three.  Neither, then, is
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sufficient to bear us in the safety through eight thousand miles of
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rock to the antipodes."
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "If the crust is of sufficient thickness we shall come to a final stop
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: between six and seven hundred miles beneath the earth's surface; but
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: during the last hundred and fifty miles of our journey we shall be
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: corpses.  Am I correct?" I asked.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Quite correct, David.  Are you frightened?"
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I do not know.  It all has come so suddenly that I scarce believe that
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: either of us realizes the real terrors of our position.  I feel that I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: should be reduced to panic; but yet I am not.  I imagine that the shock
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: has been so great as to partially stun our sensibilities."
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Again I turned to the thermometer.  The mercury was rising with less
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rapidity.  It was now but 140 degrees, although we had penetrated to a
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: depth of nearly four miles.  I told Perry, and he smiled.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "We have shattered one theory at least," was his only comment, and then
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: he returned to his self-assumed occupation of fluently cursing the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: steering wheel.  I once heard a pirate swear, but his best efforts
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: would have seemed like those of a tyro alongside of Perry's masterful
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and scientific imprecations.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Once more I tried my hand at the wheel, but I might as well have
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: essayed to swing the earth itself.  At my suggestion Perry stopped the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: generator, and as we came to rest I again threw all my strength into a
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: supreme effort to move the thing even a hair's breadth--but the results
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were as barren as when we had been traveling at top speed.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I shook my head sadly, and motioned to the starting lever.  Perry
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: pulled it toward him, and once again we were plunging downward toward
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: eternity at the rate of seven miles an hour.  I sat with my eyes glued
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to the thermometer and the distance meter.  The mercury was rising very
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: slowly now, though even at 145 degrees it was almost unbearable within
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the narrow confines of our metal prison.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: About noon, or twelve hours after our start upon this unfortunate
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: journey, we had bored to a depth of eighty-four miles, at which point
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the mercury registered 153 degrees F.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Perry was becoming more hopeful, although upon what meager food he
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sustained his optimism I could not conjecture.  From cursing he had
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: turned to singing--I felt that the strain had at last affected his
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mind.  For several hours we had not spoken except as he asked me for
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the readings of the instruments from time to time, and I announced
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: them.  My thoughts were filled with vain regrets.  I recalled numerous
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: acts of my past life which I should have been glad to have had a few
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: more years to live down.  There was the affair in the Latin Commons at
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Andover when Calhoun and I had put gunpowder in the stove--and nearly
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: killed one of the masters.  And then--but what was the use, I was about
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to die and atone for all these things and several more.  Already the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: heat was sufficient to give me a foretaste of the hereafter.  A few
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: more degrees and I felt that I should lose consciousness.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "What are the readings now, David?" Perry's voice broke in upon my
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: somber reflections.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Ninety miles and 153 degrees," I replied.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Gad, but we've knocked that thirty-mile-crust theory into a cocked
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hat!" he cried gleefully.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Precious lot of good it will do us," I growled back.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "But my boy," he continued, "doesn't that temperature reading mean
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: anything to you?  Why it hasn't gone up in six miles.  Think of it,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: son!"
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Yes, I'm thinking of it," I answered; "but what difference will it
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: make when our air supply is exhausted whether the temperature is 153
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: degrees or 153,000?  We'll be just as dead, and no one will know the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: difference, anyhow." But I must admit that for some unaccountable
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: reason the stationary temperature did renew my waning hope.  What I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hoped for I could not have explained, nor did I try.  The very fact, as
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Perry took pains to explain, of the blasting of several very exact and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: learned scientific hypotheses made it apparent that we could not know
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: what lay before us within the bowels of the earth, and so we might
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: continue to hope for the best, at least until we were dead--when hope
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: would no longer be essential to our happiness.  It was very good, and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: logical reasoning, and so I embraced it.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At one hundred miles the temperature had DROPPED TO 152 1/2 DEGREES!
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: When I announced it Perry reached over and hugged me.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: From then on until noon of the second day, it continued to drop until
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: it became as uncomfortably cold as it had been unbearably hot before.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At the depth of two hundred and forty miles our nostrils were assailed
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: by almost overpowering ammonia fumes, and the temperature had dropped
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to TEN BELOW ZERO!  We suffered nearly two hours of this intense and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: bitter cold, until at about two hundred and forty-five miles from the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: surface of the earth we entered a stratum of solid ice, when the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mercury quickly rose to 32 degrees.  During the next three hours we
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: passed through ten miles of ice, eventually emerging into another
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: series of ammonia-impregnated strata, where the mercury again fell to
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ten degrees below zero.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Slowly it rose once more until we were convinced that at last we were
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: nearing the molten interior of the earth.  At four hundred miles the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: temperature had reached 153 degrees.  Feverishly I watched the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: thermometer.  Slowly it rose.  Perry had ceased singing and was at last
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: praying.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Our hopes had received such a deathblow that the gradually increasing
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: heat seemed to our distorted imaginations much greater than it really
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was.  For another hour I saw that pitiless column of mercury rise and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rise until at four hundred and ten miles it stood at 153 degrees.  Now
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: it was that we began to hang upon those readings in almost breathless
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: anxiety.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: One hundred and fifty-three degrees had been the maximum temperature
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: above the ice stratum.  Would it stop at this point again, or would it
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: continue its merciless climb?  We knew that there was no hope, and yet
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with the persistence of life itself we continued to hope against
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: practical certainty.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Already the air tanks were at low ebb--there was barely enough of the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: precious gases to sustain us for another twelve hours.  But would we be
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: alive to know or care?  It seemed incredible.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At four hundred and twenty miles I took another reading.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Perry!" I shouted.  "Perry, man!  She's going down! She's going down!
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: She's 152 degrees again."
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Gad!" he cried.  "What can it mean?  Can the earth be cold at the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: center?"
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I do not know, Perry," I answered; "but thank God, if I am to die it
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shall not be by fire--that is all that I have feared.  I can face the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: thought of any death but that."
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Down, down went the mercury until it stood as low as it had seven miles
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: from the surface of the earth, and then of a sudden the realization
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: broke upon us that death was very near.  Perry was the first to
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: discover it.  I saw him fussing with the valves that regulate the air
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: supply.  And at the same time I experienced difficulty in breathing.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: My head felt dizzy--my limbs heavy.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I saw Perry crumple in his seat.  He gave himself a shake and sat erect
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: again.  Then he turned toward me.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Good-bye, David," he said.  "I guess this is the end," and then he
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: smiled and closed his eyes.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Good-bye, Perry, and good luck to you," I answered, smiling back at
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: him.  But I fought off that awful lethargy.  I was very young--I did
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: not want to die.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: For an hour I battled against the cruelly enveloping death that
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: surrounded me upon all sides.  At first I found that by climbing high
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: into the framework above me I could find more of the precious
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: life-giving elements, and for a while these sustained me.  It must have
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: been an hour after Perry had succumbed that I at last came to the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: realization that I could no longer carry on this unequal struggle
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: against the inevitable.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: With my last flickering ray of consciousness I turned mechanically
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: toward the distance meter.  It stood at exactly five hundred miles from
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the earth's surface--and then of a sudden the huge thing that bore us
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: came to a stop.  The rattle of hurtling rock through the hollow jacket
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ceased.  The wild racing of the giant drill betokened that it was
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: running loose in AIR--and then another truth flashed upon me.  The
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: point of the prospector was ABOVE us.  Slowly it dawned on me that
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: since passing through the ice strata it had been above.  We had turned
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in the ice and sped upward toward the earth's crust.  Thank God! We
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were safe!
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I put my nose to the intake pipe through which samples were to have
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: been taken during the passage of the prospector through the earth, and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my fondest hopes were realized--a flood of fresh air was pouring into
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the iron cabin.  The reaction left me in a state of collapse, and I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lost consciousness.

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: II
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: A STRANGE WORLD
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I was unconscious little more than an instant, for as I lunged forward
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: from the crossbeam to which I had been clinging, and fell with a crash
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to the floor of the cabin, the shock brought me to myself.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: My first concern was with Perry.  I was horrified at the thought that
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon the very threshold of salvation he might be dead.  Tearing open
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: his shirt I placed my ear to his breast.  I could have cried with
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: relief--his heart was beating quite regularly.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At the water tank I wetted my handkerchief, slapping it smartly across
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: his forehead and face several times.  In a moment I was rewarded by the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: raising of his lids.  For a time he lay wide-eyed and quite
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: uncomprehending.  Then his scattered wits slowly foregathered, and he
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sat up sniffing the air with an expression of wonderment upon his face.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Why, David," he cried at last, "it's air, as sure as I live.  Why--why
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: what does it mean?  Where in the world are we?  What has happened?"
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "It means that we're back at the surface all right, Perry," I cried;
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "but where, I don't know.  I haven't opened her up yet.  Been too busy
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: reviving you.  Lord, man, but you had a close squeak!"
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "You say we're back at the surface, David?  How can that be?  How long
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: have I been unconscious?"
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Not long.  We turned in the ice stratum.  Don't you recall the sudden
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: whirling of our seats?  After that the drill was above you instead of
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: below.  We didn't notice it at the time; but I recall it now."
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "You mean to say that we turned back in the ice stratum, David?  That
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: is not possible.  The prospector cannot turn unless its nose is
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: deflected from the outside--by some external force or resistance--the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: steering wheel within would have moved in response.  The steering wheel
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: has not budged, David, since we started.  You know that."
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I did know it; but here we were with our drill racing in pure air, and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: copious volumes of it pouring into the cabin.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "We couldn't have turned in the ice stratum, Perry, I know as well as
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: you," I replied; "but the fact remains that we did, for here we are
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: this minute at the surface of the earth again, and I am going out to
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: see just where."
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Better wait till morning, David--it must be midnight now."
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I glanced at the chronometer.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Half after twelve.  We have been out seventy-two hours, so it must be
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: midnight.  Nevertheless I am going to have a look at the blessed sky
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that I had given up all hope of ever seeing again," and so saying I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lifted the bars from the inner door, and swung it open.  There was
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: quite a quantity of loose material in the jacket, and this I had to
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: remove with a shovel to get at the opposite door in the outer shell.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: In a short time I had removed enough of the earth and rock to the floor
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the cabin to expose the door beyond.  Perry was directly behind me
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: as I threw it open.  The upper half was above the surface of the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ground.  With an expression of surprise I turned and looked at
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Perry--it was broad day-light without!
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Something seems to have gone wrong either with our calculations or the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: chronometer," I said.  Perry shook his head--there was a strange
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: expression in his eyes.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Let's have a look beyond that door, David," he cried.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Together we stepped out to stand in silent contemplation of a landscape
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: at once weird and beautiful.  Before us a low and level shore stretched
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: down to a silent sea.  As far as the eye could reach the surface of the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: water was dotted with countless tiny isles--some of towering, barren,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: granitic rock--others resplendent in gorgeous trappings of tropical
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: vegetation, myriad starred with the magnificent splendor of vivid
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: blooms.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Behind us rose a dark and forbidding wood of giant arborescent ferns
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: intermingled with the commoner types of a primeval tropical forest.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Huge creepers depended in great loops from tree to tree, dense
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: under-brush overgrew a tangled mass of fallen trunks and branches.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Upon the outer verge we could see the same splendid coloring of
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: countless blossoms that glorified the islands, but within the dense
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shadows all seemed dark and gloomy as the grave.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: And upon all the noonday sun poured its torrid rays out of a cloudless
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sky.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Where on earth can we be?" I asked, turning to Perry.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: For some moments the old man did not reply.  He stood with bowed head,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: buried in deep thought.  But at last he spoke.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "David," he said, "I am not so sure that we are ON earth."
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "What do you mean Perry?" I cried.  "Do you think that we are dead, and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: this is heaven?" He smiled, and turning, pointing to the nose of the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: prospector protruding from the ground at our backs.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "But for that, David, I might believe that we were indeed come to the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: country beyond the Styx.  The prospector renders that theory
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: untenable--it, certainly, could never have gone to heaven.  However I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: am willing to concede that we actually may be in another world from
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that which we have always known.  If we are not ON earth, there is
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: every reason to believe that we may be IN it."
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "We may have quartered through the earth's crust and come out upon some
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: tropical island of the West Indies," I suggested.  Again Perry shook
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: his head.

text: branches of the trees.  As we approached it my escort broke into wild
title: At the Earth's Core

title: At the Earth's Core
