text: a swarm of creatures of the same strange race as those who had captured
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me poured out to meet us.  Again I was the center of a wildly
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: chattering horde.  I was pulled this way and that.  Pinched, pounded,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and thumped until I was black and blue, yet I do not think that their
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: treatment was dictated by either cruelty or malice--I was a curiosity,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a freak, a new plaything, and their childish minds required the added
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: evidence of all their senses to back up the testimony of their eyes.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Presently they dragged me within the village, which consisted of
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: several hundred rude shelters of boughs and leaves supported upon the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: branches of the trees.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Between the huts, which sometimes formed crooked streets, were dead
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: branches and the trunks of small trees which connected the huts upon
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: one tree to those within adjoining trees; the whole network of huts and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: pathways forming an almost solid flooring a good fifty feet above the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ground.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I wondered why these agile creatures required connecting bridges
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: between the trees, but later when I saw the motley aggregation of
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: half-savage beasts which they kept within their village I realized the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: necessity for the pathways.  There were a number of the same vicious
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: wolf-dogs which we had left worrying the dyryth, and many goatlike
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: animals whose distended udders explained the reasons for their presence.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: My guard halted before one of the huts into which I was pushed; then
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: two of the creatures squatted down before the entrance--to prevent my
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: escape, doubtless.  Though where I should have escaped to I certainly
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had not the remotest conception.  I had no more than entered the dark
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shadows of the interior than there fell upon my ears the tones of a
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: familiar voice, in prayer.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Perry!" I cried.  "Dear old Perry!  Thank the Lord you are safe."
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "David!  Can it be possible that you escaped?" And the old man stumbled
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: toward me and threw his arms about me.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He had seen me fall before the dyryth, and then he had been seized by a
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: number of the ape-creatures and borne through the tree tops to their
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: village.  His captors had been as inquisitive as to his strange
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: clothing as had mine, with the same result.  As we looked at each other
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: we could not help but laugh.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "With a tail, David," remarked Perry, "you would make a very handsome
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ape."
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Maybe we can borrow a couple," I rejoined.  "They seem to be quite the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: thing this season.  I wonder what the creatures intend doing with us,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Perry.  They don't seem really savage.  What do you suppose they can
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: be?  You were about to tell me where we are when that great hairy
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: frigate bore down upon us--have you really any idea at all?"
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Yes, David," he replied, "I know precisely where we are.  We have made
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a magnificent discovery, my boy!  We have proved that the earth is
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hollow.  We have passed entirely through its crust to the inner world."
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Perry, you are mad!"
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Not at all, David.  For two hundred and fifty miles our prospector
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: bore us through the crust beneath our outer world.  At that point it
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: reached the center of gravity of the five-hundred-mile-thick crust.  Up
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to that point we had been descending--direction is, of course, merely
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: relative.  Then at the moment that our seats revolved--the thing that
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: made you believe that we had turned about and were speeding upward--we
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: passed the center of gravity and, though we did not alter the direction
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of our progress, yet we were in reality moving upward--toward the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: surface of the inner world.  Does not the strange fauna and flora which
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: we have seen convince you that you are not in the world of your birth?
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: And the horizon--could it present the strange aspects which we both
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: noted unless we were indeed standing upon the inside surface of a
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sphere?"
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "But the sun, Perry!" I urged.  "How in the world can the sun shine
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: through five hundred miles of solid crust?"
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "It is not the sun of the outer world that we see here.  It is another
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sun--an entirely different sun--that casts its eternal noonday
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: effulgence upon the face of the inner world.  Look at it now, David--if
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: you can see it from the doorway of this hut--and you will see that it
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: is still in the exact center of the heavens.  We have been here for
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: many hours--yet it is still noon.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "And withal it is very simple, David.  The earth was once a nebulous
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mass.  It cooled, and as it cooled it shrank.  At length a thin crust
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of solid matter formed upon its outer surface--a sort of shell; but
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: within it was partially molten matter and highly expanded gases.  As it
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: continued to cool, what happened?  Centrifugal force burled the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: particles of the nebulous center toward the crust as rapidly as they
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: approached a solid state.  You have seen the same principle practically
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: applied in the modern cream separator.  Presently there was only a
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: small super-heated core of gaseous matter remaining within a huge
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: vacant interior left by the contraction of the cooling gases.  The
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: equal attraction of the solid crust from all directions maintained this
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: luminous core in the exact center of the hollow globe.  What remains of
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: it is the sun you saw today--a relatively tiny thing at the exact
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: center of the earth.  Equally to every part of this inner world it
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: diffuses its perpetual noonday light and torrid heat.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "This inner world must have cooled sufficiently to support animal life
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: long ages after life appeared upon the outer crust, but that the same
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: agencies were at work here is evident from the similar forms of both
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: animal and vegetable creation which we have already seen.  Take the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: great beast which attacked us, for example.  Unquestionably a
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: counterpart of the Megatherium of the post-Pliocene period of the outer
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: crust, whose fossilized skeleton has been found in South America."
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "But the grotesque inhabitants of this forest?" I urged.  "Surely they
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: have no counterpart in the earth's history."
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Who can tell?" he rejoined.  "They may constitute the link between ape
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and man, all traces of which have been swallowed by the countless
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: convulsions which have racked the outer crust, or they may be merely
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the result of evolution along slightly different lines--either is quite
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: possible."
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Further speculation was interrupted by the appearance of several of our
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: captors before the entrance of the hut.  Two of them entered and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dragged us forth.  The perilous pathways and the surrounding trees were
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: filled with the black ape-men, their females, and their young.  There
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was not an ornament, a weapon, or a garment among the lot.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Quite low in the scale of creation," commented Perry.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Quite high enough to play the deuce with us, though," I replied.  "Now
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: what do you suppose they intend doing with us?"
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We were not long in learning.  As on the occasion of our trip to the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: village we were seized by a couple of the powerful creatures and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: whirled away through the tree tops, while about us and in our wake
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: raced a chattering, jabbering, grinning horde of sleek, black
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ape-things.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Twice my bearers missed their footing, and my heart ceased beating as
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: we plunged toward instant death among the tangled deadwood beneath.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: But on both occasions those lithe, powerful tails reached out and found
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sustaining branches, nor did either of the creatures loosen their grasp
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon me.  In fact, it seemed that the incidents were of no greater
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: moment to them than would be the stubbing of one's toe at a street
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: crossing in the outer world--they but laughed uproariously and sped on
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with me.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: For some time they continued through the forest--how long I could not
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: guess for I was learning, what was later borne very forcefully to my
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mind, that time ceases to be a factor the moment means for measuring it
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cease to exist.  Our watches were gone, and we were living beneath a
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: stationary sun.  Already I was puzzled to compute the period of time
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which had elapsed since we broke through the crust of the inner world.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It might be hours, or it might be days--who in the world could tell
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: where it was always noon!  By the sun, no time had elapsed--but my
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: judgment told me that we must have been several hours in this strange
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: world.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Presently the forest terminated, and we came out upon a level plain.  A
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: short distance before us rose a few low, rocky hills.  Toward these our
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: captors urged us, and after a short time led us through a narrow pass
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: into a tiny, circular valley.  Here they got down to work, and we were
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: soon convinced that if we were not to die to make a Roman holiday, we
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were to die for some other purpose.  The attitude of our captors
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: altered immediately as they entered the natural arena within the rocky
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hills.  Their laughter ceased.  Grim ferocity marked their bestial
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: faces--bared fangs menaced us.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We were placed in the center of the amphitheater--the thousand
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: creatures forming a great ring about us.  Then a wolf-dog was
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: brought--hyaenodon Perry called it--and turned loose with us inside the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: circle.  The thing's body was as large as that of a full-grown mastiff,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: its legs were short and powerful, and its jaws broad and strong.  Dark,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shaggy hair covered its back and sides, while its breast and belly were
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: quite white.  As it slunk toward us it presented a most formidable
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: aspect with its upcurled lips baring its mighty fangs.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Perry was on his knees, praying.  I stooped and picked up a small
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: stone.  At my movement the beast veered off a bit and commenced
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: circling us.  Evidently it had been a target for stones before.  The
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ape-things were dancing up and down urging the brute on with savage
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cries, until at last, seeing that I did not throw, he charged us.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At Andover, and later at Yale, I had pitched on winning ball teams.  My
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: speed and control must both have been above the ordinary, for I made
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: such a record during my senior year at college that overtures were made
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to me in behalf of one of the great major-league teams; but in the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: tightest pitch that ever had confronted me in the past I had never been
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in such need for control as now.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As I wound up for the delivery, I held my nerves and muscles under
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: absolute command, though the grinning jaws were hurtling toward me at
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: terrific speed.  And then I let go, with every ounce of my weight and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: muscle and science in back of that throw.  The stone caught the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hyaenodon full upon the end of the nose, and sent him bowling over upon
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: his back.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At the same instant a chorus of shrieks and howls arose from the circle
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of spectators, so that for a moment I thought that the upsetting of
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: their champion was the cause; but in this I soon saw that I was
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mistaken.  As I looked, the ape-things broke in all directions toward
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the surrounding hills, and then I distinguished the real cause of their
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: perturbation.  Behind them, streaming through the pass which leads into
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the valley, came a swarm of hairy men--gorilla-like creatures armed
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with spears and hatchets, and bearing long, oval shields.  Like demons
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: they set upon the ape-things, and before them the hyaenodon, which had
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: now regained its senses and its feet, fled howling with fright.  Past
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: us swept the pursued and the pursuers, nor did the hairy ones accord us
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: more than a passing glance until the arena had been emptied of its
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: former occupants.  Then they returned to us, and one who seemed to have
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: authority among them directed that we be brought with them.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: When we had passed out of the amphitheater onto the great plain we saw
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a caravan of men and women--human beings like ourselves--and for the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: first time hope and relief filled my heart, until I could have cried
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: out in the exuberance of my happiness.  It is true that they were a
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: half-naked, wild-appearing aggregation; but they at least were
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fashioned along the same lines as ourselves--there was nothing
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: grotesque or horrible about them as about the other creatures in this
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: strange, weird world.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: But as we came closer, our hearts sank once more, for we discovered
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that the poor wretches were chained neck to neck in a long line, and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that the gorilla-men were their guards.  With little ceremony Perry and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I were chained at the end of the line, and without further ado the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: interrupted march was resumed.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Up to this time the excitement had kept us both up; but now the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: tiresome monotony of the long march across the sun-baked plain brought
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: on all the agonies consequent to a long-denied sleep.  On and on we
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: stumbled beneath that hateful noonday sun.  If we fell we were prodded
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with a sharp point.  Our companions in chains did not stumble.  They
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: strode along proudly erect.  Occasionally they would exchange words
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with one another in a monosyllabic language.  They were a
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: noble-appearing race with well-formed heads and perfect physiques.  The
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: men were heavily bearded, tall and muscular; the women, smaller and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: more gracefully molded, with great masses of raven hair caught into
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: loose knots upon their heads.  The features of both sexes were well
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: proportioned--there was not a face among them that would have been
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: called even plain if judged by earthly standards.  They wore no
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ornaments; but this I later learned was due to the fact that their
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: captors had stripped them of everything of value.  As garmenture the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: women possessed a single robe of some light-colored, spotted hide,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rather similar in appearance to a leopard's skin.  This they wore
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: either supported entirely about the waist by a leathern thong, so that
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: it hung partially below the knee on one side, or possibly looped
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: gracefully across one shoulder.  Their feet were shod with skin
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sandals.  The men wore loin cloths of the hide of some shaggy beast,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: long ends of which depended before and behind nearly to the ground.  In
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: some instances these ends were finished with the strong talons of the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: beast from which the hides had been taken.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Our guards, whom I already have described as gorilla-like men, were
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rather lighter in build than a gorilla, but even so they were indeed
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mighty creatures.  Their arms and legs were proportioned more in
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: conformity with human standards, but their entire bodies were covered
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with shaggy, brown hair, and their faces were quite as brutal as those
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the few stuffed specimens of the gorilla which I had seen in the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: museums at home.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Their only redeeming feature lay in the development of the head above
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and back of the ears.  In this respect they were not one whit less
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: human than we.  They were clothed in a sort of tunic of light cloth
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which reached to the knees.  Beneath this they wore only a loin cloth
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the same material, while their feet were shod with thick hide of
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: some mammoth creature of this inner world.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Their arms and necks were encircled by many ornaments of metal--silver
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: predominating--and on their tunics were sewn the heads of tiny reptiles
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in odd and rather artistic designs.  They talked among themselves as
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: they marched along on either side of us, but in a language which I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: perceived differed from that employed by our fellow prisoners.  When
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: they addressed the latter they used what appeared to be a third
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: language, and which I later learned is a mongrel tongue rather
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: analogous to the Pidgin-English of the Chinese coolie.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: How far we marched I have no conception, nor has Perry.  Both of us
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were asleep much of the time for hours before a halt was called--then
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: we dropped in our tracks.  I say "for hours," but how may one measure
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: time where time does not exist!  When our march commenced the sun stood
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: at zenith.  When we halted our shadows still pointed toward nadir.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Whether an instant or an eternity of earthly time elapsed who may say.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: That march may have occupied nine years and eleven months of the ten
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: years that I spent in the inner world, or it may have been accomplished
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in the fraction of a second--I cannot tell.  But this I do know that
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: since you have told me that ten years have elapsed since I departed
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: from this earth I have lost all respect for time--I am commencing to
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: doubt that such a thing exists other than in the weak, finite mind of
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: man.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: IV
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: DIAN THE BEAUTIFUL
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: When our guards aroused us from sleep we were much refreshed.  They
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: gave us food.  Strips of dried meat it was, but it put new life and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: strength into us, so that now we too marched with high-held heads, and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: took noble strides.  At least I did, for I was young and proud; but
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: poor Perry hated walking.  On earth I had often seen him call a cab to
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: travel a square--he was paying for it now, and his old legs wobbled so
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that I put my arm about him and half carried him through the balance of
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: those frightful marches.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The country began to change at last, and we wound up out of the level
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: plain through mighty mountains of virgin granite.  The tropical verdure
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the lowlands was replaced by hardier vegetation, but even here the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: effects of constant heat and light were apparent in the immensity of
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the trees and the profusion of foliage and blooms.  Crystal streams
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: roared through their rocky channels, fed by the perpetual snows which
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: we could see far above us.  Above the snowcapped heights hung masses of
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: heavy clouds.  It was these, Perry explained, which evidently served
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the double purpose of replenishing the melting snows and protecting
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: them from the direct rays of the sun.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: By this time we had picked up a smattering of the bastard language in
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which our guards addressed us, as well as making good headway in the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rather charming tongue of our co-captives. Directly ahead of me in the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: chain gang was a young woman.  Three feet of chain linked us together
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in a forced companionship which I, at least, soon rejoiced in.  For I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: found her a willing teacher, and from her I learned the language of her
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: tribe, and much of the life and customs of the inner world--at least
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that part of it with which she was familiar.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: She told me that she was called Dian the Beautiful, and that she
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: belonged to the tribe of Amoz, which dwells in the cliffs above the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Darel Az, or shallow sea.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "How came you here?" I asked her.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I was running away from Jubal the Ugly One," she answered, as though
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that was explanation quite sufficient.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Who is Jubal the Ugly One?" I asked.  "And why did you run away from
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: him?"
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: She looked at me in surprise.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Why DOES a woman run away from a man?" she answered my question with
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: another.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "They do not, where I come from," I replied.  "Sometimes they run after
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: them."
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: But she could not understand.  Nor could I get her to grasp the fact
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that I was of another world.  She was quite as positive that creation
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was originated solely to produce her own kind and the world she lived
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in as are many of the outer world.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "But Jubal," I insisted.  "Tell me about him, and why you ran away to
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: be chained by the neck and scourged across the face of a world."
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Jubal the Ugly One placed his trophy before my father's house.  It was
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the head of a mighty tandor.  It remained there and no greater trophy
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was placed beside it.  So I knew that Jubal the Ugly One would come and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: take me as his mate.  None other so powerful wished me, or they would
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: have slain a mightier beast and thus have won me from Jubal.  My father
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: is not a mighty hunter.  Once he was, but a sadok tossed him, and never
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: again had he the full use of his right arm.  My brother, Dacor the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Strong One, had gone to the land of Sari to steal a mate for himself.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Thus there was none, father, brother, or lover, to save me from Jubal
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the Ugly One, and I ran away and hid among the hills that skirt the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: land of Amoz.  And there these Sagoths found me and made me captive."
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "What will they do with you?" I asked.  "Where are they taking us?"
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Again she looked her incredulity.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I can almost believe that you are of another world," she said, "for
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: otherwise such ignorance were inexplicable.  Do you really mean that
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: you do not know that the Sagoths are the creatures of the Mahars--the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mighty Mahars who think they own Pellucidar and all that walks or grows
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon its surface, or creeps or burrows beneath, or swims within its
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lakes and oceans, or flies through its air?  Next you will be telling
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me that you never before heard of the Mahars!"
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I was loath to do it, and further incur her scorn; but there was no
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: alternative if I were to absorb knowledge, so I made a clean breast of
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my pitiful ignorance as to the mighty Mahars.  She was shocked.  But
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: she did her very best to enlighten me, though much that she said was as
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Greek would have been to her.  She described the Mahars largely by
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: comparisons.  In this way they were like unto thipdars, in that to the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hairless lidi.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: About all I gleaned of them was that they were quite hideous, had
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: wings, and webbed feet; lived in cities built beneath the ground; could
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: swim under water for great distances, and were very, very wise.  The
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Sagoths were their weapons of offense and defense, and the races like
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: herself were their hands and feet--they were the slaves and servants
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: who did all the manual labor.  The Mahars were the heads--the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: brains--of the inner world.  I longed to see this wondrous race of
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: supermen.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Perry learned the language with me.  When we halted, as we occasionally
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: did, though sometimes the halts seemed ages apart, he would join in the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: conversation, as would Ghak the Hairy One, he who was chained just
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ahead of Dian the Beautiful.  Ahead of Ghak was Hooja the Sly One.  He
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: too entered the conversation occasionally.  Most of his remarks were
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: directed toward Dian the Beautiful.  It didn't take half an eye to see
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that he had developed a bad case; but the girl appeared totally
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: oblivious to his thinly veiled advances.  Did I say thinly veiled?
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: There is a race of men in New Zealand, or Australia, I have forgotten
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which, who indicate their preference for the lady of their affections
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: by banging her over the head with a bludgeon.  By comparison with this
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: method Hooja's lovemaking might be called thinly veiled.  At first it
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: caused me to blush violently although I have seen several Old Years out
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: at Rectors, and in other less fashionable places off Broadway, and in
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Vienna, and Hamburg.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: But the girl!  She was magnificent.  It was easy to see that she
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: considered herself as entirely above and apart from her present
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: surroundings and company.  She talked with me, and with Perry, and with
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the taciturn Ghak because we were respectful; but she couldn't even see
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Hooja the Sly One, much less hear him, and that made him furious.  He
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: tried to get one of the Sagoths to move the girl up ahead of him in the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: slave gang, but the fellow only poked him with his spear and told him
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that he had selected the girl for his own property--that he would buy
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: her from the Mahars as soon as they reached Phutra.  Phutra, it seemed,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was the city of our destination.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: After passing over the first chain of mountains we skirted a salt sea,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon whose bosom swam countless horrid things.  Seal-like creatures
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: there were with long necks stretching ten and more feet above their
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: enormous bodies and whose snake heads were split with gaping mouths
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: bristling with countless fangs.  There were huge tortoises too,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: paddling about among these other reptiles, which Perry said were
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Plesiosaurs of the Lias.  I didn't question his veracity--they might
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: have been most anything.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Dian told me they were tandorazes, or tandors of the sea, and that the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: other, and more fearsome reptiles, which occasionally rose from the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: deep to do battle with them, were azdyryths, or sea-dyryths--Perry
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: called them Ichthyosaurs.  They resembled a whale with the head of an
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: alligator.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I had forgotten what little geology I had studied at school--about all
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that remained was an impression of horror that the illustrations of
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: restored prehistoric monsters had made upon me, and a well-defined
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: belief that any man with a pig's shank and a vivid imagination could
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "restore" most any sort of paleolithic monster he saw fit, and take
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rank as a first class paleontologist.  But when I saw these sleek,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shiny carcasses shimmering in the sunlight as they emerged from the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ocean, shaking their giant heads; when I saw the waters roll from their
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sinuous bodies in miniature waterfalls as they glided hither and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: thither, now upon the surface, now half submerged; as I saw them meet,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: open-mouthed, hissing and snorting, in their titanic and interminable
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: warring I realized how futile is man's poor, weak imagination by
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: comparison with Nature's incredible genius.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: And Perry!  He was absolutely flabbergasted.  He said so himself.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "David," he remarked, after we had marched for a long time beside that
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: awful sea.  "David, I used to teach geology, and I thought that I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: believed what I taught; but now I see that I did not believe it--that
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: it is impossible for man to believe such things as these unless he sees
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: them with his own eyes.  We take things for granted, perhaps, because
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: we are told them over and over again, and have no way of disproving
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: them--like religions, for example; but we don't believe them, we only
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: think we do.  If you ever get back to the outer world you will find
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that the geologists and paleontologists will be the first to set you
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: down a liar, for they know that no such creatures as they restore ever
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: existed.  It is all right to IMAGINE them as existing in an equally
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: imaginary epoch--but now?  poof!"
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At the next halt Hooja the Sly One managed to find enough slack chain
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to permit him to worm himself back quite close to Dian.  We were all
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: standing, and as he edged near the girl she turned her back upon him in
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: such a truly earthly feminine manner that I could scarce repress a
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: smile; but it was a short-lived smile for on the instant the Sly One's
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hand fell upon the girl's bare arm, jerking her roughly toward him.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I was not then familiar with the customs or social ethics which
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: prevailed within Pellucidar; but even so I did not need the appealing
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: look which the girl shot to me from her magnificent eyes to influence
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my subsequent act.  What the Sly One's intention was I paused not to
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: inquire; but instead, before he could lay hold of her with his other
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hand, I placed a right to the point of his jaw that felled him in his
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: tracks.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: A roar of approval went up from those of the other prisoners and the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Sagoths who had witnessed the brief drama; not, as I later learned,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: because I had championed the girl, but for the neat and, to them,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: astounding method by which I had bested Hooja.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: And the girl?  At first she looked at me with wide, wondering eyes, and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: then she dropped her head, her face half averted, and a delicate flush
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: suffused her cheek.  For a moment she stood thus in silence, and then
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: her head went high, and she turned her back upon me as she had upon
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Hooja.  Some of the prisoners laughed, and I saw the face of Ghak the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Hairy One go very black as he looked at me searchingly.  And what I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: could see of Dian's cheek went suddenly from red to white.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Immediately after we resumed the march, and though I realized that in
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: some way I had offended Dian the Beautiful I could not prevail upon her
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to talk with me that I might learn wherein I had erred--in fact I might
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: quite as well have been addressing a sphinx for all the attention I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: got.  At last my own foolish pride stepped in and prevented my making
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: any further attempts, and thus a companionship that without my
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: realizing it had come to mean a great deal to me was cut off.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Thereafter I confined my conversation to Perry.  Hooja did not renew
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: his advances toward the girl, nor did he again venture near me.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Again the weary and apparently interminable marching became a perfect
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: nightmare of horrors to me.  The more firmly fixed became the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: realization that the girl's friendship had meant so much to me, the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: more I came to miss it; and the more impregnable the barrier of silly
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: pride.  But I was very young and would not ask Ghak for the explanation
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which I was sure he could give, and that might have made everything all
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: right again.

text: me--when her eyes wandered in my direction she looked either over my
title: At the Earth's Core

text: head or directly through me.  At last I became desperate, and
title: At the Earth's Core

text: determined to swallow my self-esteem, and again beg her to tell me how
title: At the Earth's Core

title: At the Earth's Core

text: range of mountains at the time, and when we reached them, instead of
title: At the Earth's Core

text: winding across them through some high-flung pass we entered a mighty
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: natural tunnel--a series of labyrinthine grottoes, dark as Erebus.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core

text: seen no artificial light or sign of fire since we had entered
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Pellucidar.  In a land of perpetual noon there is no need of light
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: above ground, yet I marveled that they had no means of lighting their
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: way through these dark, subterranean passages.  So we crept along at a
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: snail's pace, with much stumbling and falling--the guards keeping up a
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Halts were now more frequent, but I did not wish to speak to Dian until
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I could see from the expression of her face how she was receiving my
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: apologies.  At last a faint glow ahead forewarned us of the end of the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: tunnel, for which I for one was devoutly thankful.  Then at a sudden
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: turn we emerged into the full light of the noonday sun.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: But with it came a sudden realization of what meant to me a real
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: catastrophe--Dian was gone, and with her a half-dozen other prisoners.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The guards saw it too, and the ferocity of their rage was terrible to
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: behold.  Their awesome, bestial faces were contorted in the most
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: diabolical expressions, as they accused each other of responsibility
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for the loss.  Finally they fell upon us, beating us with their spear

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shafts, and hatchets.  They had already killed two near the head of the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: line, and were like to have finished the balance of us when their
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: leader finally put a stop to the brutal slaughter.  Never in all my
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: life had I witnessed a more horrible exhibition of bestial rage--I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: thanked God that Dian had not been one of those left to endure it.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Of the twelve prisoners who had been chained ahead of me each alternate
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: one had been freed commencing with Dian.  Hooja was gone.  Ghak

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: remained.  What could it mean?  How had it been accomplished?  The
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: commander of the guards was investigating.  Soon he discovered that the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rude locks which had held the neckbands in place had been deftly picked.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Hooja the Sly One," murmured Ghak, who was now next to me in line.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "He has taken the girl that you would not have," he continued, glancing
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: at me.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "That I would not have!" I cried.  "What do you mean?"
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He looked at me closely for a moment.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I have doubted your story that you are from another world," he said at
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: last, "but yet upon no other grounds could your ignorance of the ways
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of Pellucidar be explained.  Do you really mean that you do not know
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that you offended the Beautiful One, and how?"
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I do not know, Ghak," I replied.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Then shall I tell you.  When a man of Pellucidar intervenes between
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: another man and the woman the other man would have, the woman belongs
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to the victor.  Dian the Beautiful belongs to you.  You should have
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: claimed her or released her.  Had you taken her hand, it would have
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: indicated your desire to make her your mate, and had you raised her
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hand above her head and then dropped it, it would have meant that you
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: did not wish her for a mate and that you released her from all
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: obligation to you.  By doing neither you have put upon her the greatest
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: affront that a man may put upon a woman.  Now she is your slave.  No
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: man will take her as mate, or may take her honorably, until he shall
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: have overcome you in combat, and men do not choose slave women as their
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mates--at least not the men of Pellucidar."
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I did not know, Ghak," I cried.  "I did not know.  Not for all
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Pellucidar would I have harmed Dian the Beautiful by word, or look, or
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: act of mine.  I do not want her as my slave.  I do not want her as
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my--" but here I stopped.  The vision of that sweet and innocent face
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: floated before me amidst the soft mists of imagination, and where I had
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: on the second believed that I clung only to the memory of a gentle
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: friendship I had lost, yet now it seemed that it would have been
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: disloyalty to her to have said that I did not want Dian the Beautiful
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: as my mate.  I had not thought of her except as a welcome friend in a
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: strange, cruel world.  Even now I did not think that I loved her.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I believe Ghak must have read the truth more in my expression than in
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my words, for presently he laid his hand upon my shoulder.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Man of another world," he said, "I believe you.  Lips may lie, but
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: when the heart speaks through the eyes it tells only the truth.  Your
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: heart has spoken to me.  I know now that you meant no affront to Dian
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the Beautiful.  She is not of my tribe; but her mother is my sister.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: She does not know it--her mother was stolen by Dian's father who came
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with many others of the tribe of Amoz to battle with us for our
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: women--the most beautiful women of Pellucidar.  Then was her father
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: king of Amoz, and her mother was daughter of the king of Sari--to whose
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: power I, his son, have succeeded.  Dian is the daughter of kings,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: though her father is no longer king since the sadok tossed him and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Jubal the Ugly One wrested his kingship from him.  Because of her
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lineage the wrong you did her was greatly magnified in the eyes of all
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: who saw it.  She will never forgive you."
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I asked Ghak if there was not some way in which I could release the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: girl from the bondage and ignominy I had unwittingly placed upon her.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "If ever you find her, yes," he answered.  "Merely to raise her hand
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: above her head and drop it in the presence of others is sufficient to
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: release her; but how may you ever find her, you who are doomed to a
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: life of slavery yourself in the buried city of Phutra?"
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Is there no escape?" I asked.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Hooja the Sly One escaped and took the others with him," replied Ghak.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: it is not so easy--the Mahars are very wise.  Even if one escaped from
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: but he only shrugged his shoulders and continued a longwinded prayer he
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had been at for some time.  He was wont to say that the only redeeming
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: feature of our captivity was the ample time it gave him for the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: improvisation of prayers--it was becoming an obsession with him.  The
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Sagoths had begun to take notice of his habit of declaiming throughout
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: entire marches.  One of them asked him what he was saying--to whom he
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was talking.  The question gave me an idea, so I answered quickly
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: before Perry could say anything.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Do not interrupt him," I said.  "He is a very holy man in the world
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: from which we come.  He is speaking to spirits which you cannot see--do
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: not interrupt him or they will spring out of the air upon you and rend
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: you limb from limb--like that," and I jumped toward the great brute
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with a loud "Boo!" that sent him stumbling backward.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I took a long chance, I realized, but if we could make any capital out
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of Perry's harmless mania I wanted to make it while the making was
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: prime.  It worked splendidly.  The Sagoths treated us both with marked
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: respect during the balance of the journey, and then passed the word
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: along to their masters, the Mahars.

text: As we descended the broad staircase which led to the main avenue of
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Phutra I caught my first sight of the dominant race of the inner world.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: inspect us.  A more hideous thing it would be impossible to imagine.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The all-powerful Mahars of Pellucidar are great reptiles, some six or
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: eight feet in length, with long narrow heads and great round eyes.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Their beak-like mouths are lined with sharp, white fangs, and the backs
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of their huge, lizard bodies are serrated into bony ridges from their
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: necks to the end of their long tails.  Their feet are equipped with
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: three webbed toes, while from the fore feet membranous wings, which are
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: attached to their bodies just in front of the hind legs, protrude at an
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: angle of 45 degrees toward the rear, ending in sharp points several
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: feet above their bodies.

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was gazing at the horrid creature with wide astonished eyes.  When it
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: passed on, he turned to me.
title: At the Earth's Core

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: indicated a size greater than that attained by an ordinary crow."
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: thousand of the creatures coming and going upon their daily duties.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with a regularity that indicates remarkable engineering skill.  It is

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: this underground city, and by means of lenses and reflectors transmit
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the sunlight, softened and diffused, to dispel what would otherwise be
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Cimmerian darkness.  In like manner air is introduced.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: learn later, the Mahars have no ears, nor any spoken language.  Among

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: themselves they communicate by means of what Perry says must be a sixth

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon numerous occasions.  I suggested telepathy, but he said no, that

text: one another.

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The aborigine, apparently uninjured, climbed quickly into the skiff,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and seizing the spear with me helped to hold off the infuriated
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: creature.  Blood from the wounded reptile was now crimsoning the waters
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: about us and soon from the weakening struggles it became evident that I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ceased entirely, and with a few convulsive movements it turned upon its
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which I had placed myself.  I was entirely within the power of the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: savage man whose skiff I had stolen.  Still clinging to the spear I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: looked into his face to find him scrutinizing me intently, and there we
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the while we gazed in stupid wonderment at each other.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: translate.  I shook my head in an effort to indicate my ignorance of
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that the Sagoths use to converse with the human slaves of the Mahars.

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the skiff.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Who are you," he continued, "and from what country do you come?"
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: grasp or believe the strange tale I told him as I fear it is for you
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon the outer crust to believe in the existence of the inner world.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: world far beneath his feet peopled by beings similar to himself, and he
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: laughed uproariously the more he thought upon it.  But it was ever
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: thus.  That which has never come within the scope of our really
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: pitifully meager world-experience cannot be--our finite minds cannot
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: grasp that which may not exist in accordance with the conditions which
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: So I gave it up and asked him about himself.  He said he was a Mezop,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and that his name was Ja.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Who are the Mezops?" I asked.  "Where do they live?"
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He looked at me in surprise.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I might indeed believe that you were from another world," he said,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "for who of Pellucidar could be so ignorant!  The Mezops live upon the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: islands of the seas.  In so far as I ever have heard no Mezop lives
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: elsewhere, and no others than Mezops dwell upon islands, but of course
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: it may be different in other far-distant lands.  I do not know.  At any
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rate in this sea and those near by it is true that only people of my
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: race inhabit the islands.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "We are fishermen, though we be great hunters as well, often going to
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the mainland in search of the game that is scarce upon all but the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: larger islands.  And we are warriors also," he added proudly.  "Even
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the Sagoths of the Mahars fear us.  Once, when Pellucidar was young,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the Sagoths were wont to capture us for slaves as they do the other men
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of Pellucidar, it is handed down from father to son among us that this
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: is so; but we fought so desperately and slew so many Sagoths, and those
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of us that were captured killed so many Mahars in their own cities that
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: at last they learned that it were better to leave us alone, and later
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: came the time that the Mahars became too indolent even to catch their
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: own fish, except for amusement, and then they needed us to supply their
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: wants, and so a truce was made between the races.  Now they give us
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: certain things which we are unable to produce in return for the fish
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that we catch, and the Mezops and the Mahars live in peace.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "The great ones even come to our islands.  It is there, far from the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: prying eyes of their own Sagoths, that they practice their religious
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rites in the temples they have builded there with our assistance.  If
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: you live among us you will doubtless see the manner of their worship,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which is strange indeed, and most unpleasant for the poor slaves they
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: bring to take part in it."
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As Ja talked I had an excellent opportunity to inspect him more
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: closely.  He was a huge fellow, standing I should say six feet six or
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core
