title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: tribes, the prominent cheek bones, and black hair and eyes, but his
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: makeshift language we were compelled to use.

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: skiff with vigorous strokes toward a large island that lay some
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: half-mile from the mainland.  The skill with which he handled his crude
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and awkward craft elicited my deepest admiration, since it had been so
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: short a time before that I had made such pitiful work of it.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As we touched the pretty, level beach Ja leaped out and I followed him.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Together we dragged the skiff far up into the bushes that grew beyond
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the sand.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: always at war with us and would steal them if they found them," he
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: nodded toward an island farther out at sea, and at so great a distance
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that it seemed but a blur hanging in the distant sky.  The upward curve
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the surface of Pellucidar was constantly revealing the impossible to
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the surprised eyes of the outer-earthly. To see land and water curving
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upward in the distance until it seemed to stand on edge where it melted
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: into the distant sky, and to feel that seas and mountains hung

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the perceptive and reasoning faculties as almost to stupefy one.

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: through it to the other side, drop onto a fallen log, leap over a low

text: "I cannot believe but that you will return, David," he said.  "It would
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: be awful to think of living out the balance of my life without you
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: among these hateful and repulsive creatures.  If you are taken away I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shall never escape, for I feel that I am as well off here as I should
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: be anywhere within this buried world.  Good-bye, my boy, good-bye!" and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: then his old voice faltered and broke, and as he hid his face in his
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hands the Sagoth guardsman grasped me roughly by the shoulder and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hustled me from the chamber.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: XI
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: FOUR DEAD MAHARS
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: A moment later I was standing before a dozen Mahars--the social
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: investigators of Phutra.  They asked me many questions, through a
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Sagoth interpreter.  I answered them all truthfully.  They seemed
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: particularly interested in my account of the outer earth and the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: strange vehicle which had brought Perry and me to Pellucidar.  I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: thought that I had convinced them, and after they had sat in silence
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for a long time following my examination, I expected to be ordered
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: returned to my quarters.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: During this apparent silence they were debating through the medium of
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: strange, unspoken language the merits of my tale.  At last the head of
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the tribunal communicated the result of their conference to the officer
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in charge of the Sagoth guard.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Come," he said to me, "you are sentenced to the experimental pits for
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: having dared to insult the intelligence of the mighty ones with the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ridiculous tale you have had the temerity to unfold to them."
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Do you mean that they do not believe me?" I asked, totally astonished.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Believe you!" he laughed.  "Do you mean to say that you expected any
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: one to believe so impossible a lie?"
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It was hopeless, and so I walked in silence beside my guard down
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: through the dark corridors and runways toward my awful doom.  At a low
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: level we came upon a number of lighted chambers in which we saw many
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Mahars engaged in various occupations.  To one of these chambers my
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: guard escorted me, and before leaving they chained me to a side wall.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: There were other humans similarly chained.  Upon a long table lay a
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: victim even as I was ushered into the room.  Several Mahars stood about
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the poor creature holding him down so that he could not move.  Another,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: grasping a sharp knife with her three-toed fore foot, was laying open
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the victim's chest and abdomen.  No anesthetic had been administered
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and the shrieks and groans of the tortured man were terrible to hear.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: This, indeed, was vivisection with a vengeance.  Cold sweat broke out
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon me as I realized that soon my turn would come.  And to think that
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: where there was no such thing as time I might easily imagine that my
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: suffering was enduring for months before death finally released me!
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The Mahars had paid not the slightest attention to me as I had been
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: brought into the room.  So deeply immersed were they in their work that
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I am sure they did not even know that the Sagoths had entered with me.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The door was close by.  Would that I could reach it!  But those heavy
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: chains precluded any such possibility.  I looked about for some means
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of escape from my bonds.  Upon the floor between me and the Mahars lay
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a tiny surgical instrument which one of them must have dropped.  It
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: looked not unlike a button-hook, but was much smaller, and its point
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was sharpened.  A hundred times in my boyhood days had I picked locks
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with a button-hook.  Could I but reach that little bit of polished
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: steel I might yet effect at least a temporary escape.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Crawling to the limit of my chain, I found that by reaching one hand as
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: far out as I could my fingers still fell an inch short of the coveted
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: instrument.  It was tantalizing!  Stretch every fiber of my being as I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: would, I could not quite make it.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At last I turned about and extended one foot toward the object.  My
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: heart came to my throat!  I could just touch the thing!  But suppose
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that in my effort to drag it toward me I should accidentally shove it
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: still farther away and thus entirely out of reach!  Cold sweat broke
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: out upon me from every pore.  Slowly and cautiously I made the effort.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: My toes dropped upon the cold metal.  Gradually I worked it toward me
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: until I felt that it was within reach of my hand and a moment later I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had turned about and the precious thing was in my grasp.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Assiduously I fell to work upon the Mahar lock that held my chain.  It
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was pitifully simple.  A child might have picked it, and a moment later
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I was free.  The Mahars were now evidently completing their work at the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: table.  One already turned away and was examining other victims,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: evidently with the intention of selecting the next subject.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Those at the table had their backs toward me.  But for the creature
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: walking toward us I might have escaped that moment.  Slowly the thing
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: approached me, when its attention was attracted by a huge slave chained
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a few yards to my right.  Here the reptile stopped and commenced to go
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: over the poor devil carefully, and as it did so its back turned toward
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me for an instant, and in that instant I gave two mighty leaps that
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: carried me out of the chamber into the corridor beyond, down which I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: raced with all the speed I could command.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Where I was, or whither I was going, I knew not.  My only thought was
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to place as much distance as possible between me and that frightful
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: chamber of torture.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Presently I reduced my speed to a brisk walk, and later realizing the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: danger of running into some new predicament, were I not careful, I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: moved still more slowly and cautiously.  After a time I came to a
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: passage that seemed in some mysterious way familiar to me, and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: presently, chancing to glance within a chamber which led from the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: corridor I saw three Mahars curled up in slumber upon a bed of skins.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I could have shouted aloud in joy and relief.  It was the same corridor
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and the same Mahars that I had intended to have lead so important a
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: role in our escape from Phutra.  Providence had indeed been kind to me,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for the reptiles still slept.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: My one great danger now lay in returning to the upper levels in search
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of Perry and Ghak, but there was nothing else to be done, and so I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hastened upward.  When I came to the frequented portions of the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: building, I found a large burden of skins in a corner and these I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lifted to my head, carrying them in such a way that ends and corners
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fell down about my shoulders completely hiding my face.  Thus disguised
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I found Perry and Ghak together in the chamber where we had been wont
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to eat and sleep.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Both were glad to see me, it was needless to say, though of course they
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had known nothing of the fate that had been meted out to me by my
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: judges.  It was decided that no time should now be lost before
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: attempting to put our plan of escape to the test, as I could not hope
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to remain hidden from the Sagoths long, nor could I forever carry that
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: bale of skins about upon my head without arousing suspicion.  However
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: it seemed likely that it would carry me once more safely through the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: crowded passages and chambers of the upper levels, and so I set out
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with Perry and Ghak--the stench of the illy cured pelts fairly choking
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Together we repaired to the first tier of corridors beneath the main
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: floor of the buildings, and here Perry and Ghak halted to await me.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The buildings are cut out of the solid limestone formation.  There is
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: nothing at all remarkable about their architecture.  The rooms are
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sometimes rectangular, sometimes circular, and again oval in shape.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The corridors which connect them are narrow and not always straight.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The chambers are lighted by diffused sunlight reflected through tubes
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: similar to those by which the avenues are lighted.  The lower the tiers
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of chambers, the darker.  Most of the corridors are entirely unlighted.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The Mahars can see quite well in semidarkness.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Down to the main floor we encountered many Mahars, Sagoths, and slaves;
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: but no attention was paid to us as we had become a part of the domestic
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: life of the building.  There was but a single entrance leading from the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: place into the avenue and this was well guarded by Sagoths--this
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: doorway alone were we forbidden to pass.  It is true that we were not
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: supposed to enter the deeper corridors and apartments except on special
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: occasions when we were instructed to do so; but as we were considered a
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lower order without intelligence there was little reason to fear that
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: we could accomplish any harm by so doing, and so we were not hindered
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: as we entered the corridor which led below.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Wrapped in a skin I carried three swords, and the two bows, and the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: arrows which Perry and I had fashioned.  As many slaves bore
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: skin-wrapped burdens to and fro my load attracted no comment.  Where I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: left Ghak and Perry there were no other creatures in sight, and so I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: withdrew one sword from the package, and leaving the balance of the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: weapons with Perry, started on alone toward the lower levels.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Having come to the apartment in which the three Mahars slept I entered
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: silently on tiptoe, forgetting that the creatures were without the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sense of hearing.  With a quick thrust through the heart I disposed of
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the first but my second thrust was not so fortunate, so that before I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: could kill the next of my victims it had hurled itself against the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: third, who sprang quickly up, facing me with wide-distended jaws.  But
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fighting is not the occupation which the race of Mahars loves, and when
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the thing saw that I already had dispatched two of its companions, and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that my sword was red with their blood, it made a dash to escape me.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: But I was too quick for it, and so, half hopping, half flying, it
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: scurried down another corridor with me close upon its heels.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Its escape meant the utter ruin of our plan, and in all probability my
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: instant death.  This thought lent wings to my feet; but even at my best
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I could do no more than hold my own with the leaping thing before me.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Of a sudden it turned into an apartment on the right of the corridor,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and an instant later as I rushed in I found myself facing two of the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Mahars.  The one who had been there when we entered had been occupied
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with a number of metal vessels, into which had been put powders and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: liquids as I judged from the array of flasks standing about upon the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: bench where it had been working.  In an instant I realized what I had
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: stumbled upon.  It was the very room for the finding of which Perry had
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: given me minute directions.  It was the buried chamber in which was
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hidden the Great Secret of the race of Mahars.  And on the bench beside
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the flasks lay the skin-bound book which held the only copy of the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: thing I was to have sought, after dispatching the three Mahars in their
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sleep.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: There was no exit from the room other than the doorway in which I now
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: stood facing the two frightful reptiles.  Cornered, I knew that they
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: would fight like demons, and they were well equipped to fight if fight
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: they must.  Together they launched themselves upon me, and though I ran
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: one of them through the heart on the instant, the other fastened its
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: gleaming fangs about my sword arm above the elbow, and then with her
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sharp talons commenced to rake me about the body, evidently intent upon
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: disemboweling me.  I saw that it was useless to hope that I might
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: release my arm from that powerful, viselike grip which seemed to be
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: severing my arm from my body.  The pain I suffered was intense, but it
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: only served to spur me to greater efforts to overcome my antagonist.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Back and forth across the floor we struggled--the Mahar dealing me
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: terrific, cutting blows with her fore feet, while I attempted to
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: protect my body with my left hand, at the same time watching for an
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: opportunity to transfer my blade from my now useless sword hand to its
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rapidly weakening mate.  At last I was successful, and with what seemed
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to me my last ounce of strength I ran the blade through the ugly body
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of my foe.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Soundless, as it had fought, it died, and though weak from pain and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: loss of blood, it was with an emotion of triumphant pride that I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: stepped across its convulsively stiffening corpse to snatch up the most
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: potent secret of a world.  A single glance assured me it was the very
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: thing that Perry had described to me.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: And as I grasped it did I think of what it meant to the human race of
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Pellucidar--did there flash through my mind the thought that countless
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: generations of my own kind yet unborn would have reason to worship me
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for the thing that I had accomplished for them?  I did not.  I thought
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of a beautiful oval face, gazing out of limpid eyes, through a waving
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mass of jet-black hair.  I thought of red, red lips, God-made for
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: kissing.  And of a sudden, apropos of nothing, standing there alone in
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the secret chamber of the Mahars of Pellucidar, I realized that I loved
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Dian the Beautiful.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: XII
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: PURSUIT
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: For an instant I stood there thinking of her, and then, with a sigh, I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: tucked the book in the thong that supported my loin cloth, and turned
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to leave the apartment.  At the bottom of the corridor which leads
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: aloft from the lower chambers I whistled in accordance with the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: prearranged signal which was to announce to Perry and Ghak that I had
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: been successful.  A moment later they stood beside me, and to my
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: surprise I saw that Hooja the Sly One accompanied them.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "He joined us," explained Perry, "and would not be denied.  The fellow
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: is a fox.  He scents escape, and rather than be thwarted of our chance
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: now I told him that I would bring him to you, and let you decide
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: whether he might accompany us."
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I had no love for Hooja, and no confidence in him.  I was sure that if
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: he thought it would profit him he would betray us; but I saw no way out
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of it now, and the fact that I had killed four Mahars instead of only
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the three I had expected to, made it possible to include the fellow in
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: our scheme of escape.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Very well," I said, "you may come with us, Hooja; but at the first
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: intimation of treachery I shall run my sword through you.  Do you
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: understand?"
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He said that he did.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Some time later we had removed the skins from the four Mahars, and so
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: succeeded in crawling inside of them ourselves that there seemed an
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: excellent chance for us to pass unnoticed from Phutra.  It was not an

title: At the Earth's Core

title: At the Earth's Core

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: gorilla-man.

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and retreated toward the main body of gorilla-men.  Evidently he had
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: seen enough of me for the moment.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Once more I took up my flight, nor were the Sagoths apparently
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: overanxious to press their pursuit so closely as before.  Unmolested I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: reached the top of the canyon where I found a sheer drop of two or
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: three hundred feet to the bottom of a rocky chasm; but on the left a
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: narrow ledge rounded the shoulder of the overhanging cliff.  Along this
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I advanced, and at a sudden turning, a few yards beyond the canyon's
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: end, the path widened, and at my left I saw the opening to a large
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cave.  Before, the ledge continued until it passed from sight about
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: another projecting buttress of the mountain.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Here, I felt, I could defy an army, for but a single foeman could
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: advance upon me at a time, nor could he know that I was awaiting him
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: until he came full upon me around the corner of the turn.  About me lay
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: scattered stones crumbled from the cliff above.  They were of various
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sizes and shapes, but enough were of handy dimensions for use as
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ammunition in lieu of my precious arrows.  Gathering a number of stones
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: into a little pile beside the mouth of the cave I waited the advance of
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the Sagoths.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As I stood there, tense and silent, listening for the first faint sound
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that should announce the approach of my enemies, a slight noise from
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: within the cave's black depths attracted my attention.  It might have
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: been produced by the moving of the great body of some huge beast rising
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: from the rock floor of its lair.  At almost the same instant I thought
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that I caught the scraping of hide sandals upon the ledge beyond the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: turn.  For the next few seconds my attention was considerably divided.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: And then from the inky blackness at my right I saw two flaming eyes
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: glaring into mine.  They were on a level that was over two feet above
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my head.  It is true that the beast who owned them might be standing
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon a ledge within the cave, or that it might be rearing up upon its
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hind legs; but I had seen enough of the monsters of Pellucidar to know
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that I might be facing some new and frightful Titan whose dimensions
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and ferocity eclipsed those of any I had seen before.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Whatever it was, it was coming slowly toward the entrance of the cave,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and now, deep and forbidding, it uttered a low and ominous growl.  I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: waited no longer to dispute possession of the ledge with the thing
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which owned that voice.  The noise had not been loud--I doubt if the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Sagoths heard it at all--but the suggestion of latent possibilities
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: behind it was such that I knew it would only emanate from a gigantic
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and ferocious beast.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As I backed along the ledge I soon was past the mouth of the cave,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: where I no longer could see those fearful flaming eyes, but an instant
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: later I caught sight of the fiendish face of a Sagoth as it warily
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: advanced beyond the cliff's turn on the far side of the cave's mouth.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As the fellow saw me he leaped along the ledge in pursuit, and after
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: him came as many of his companions as could crowd upon each other's
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: heels.  At the same time the beast emerged from the cave, so that he
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and the Sagoths came face to face upon that narrow ledge.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The thing was an enormous cave bear, rearing its colossal bulk fully
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: eight feet at the shoulder, while from the tip of its nose to the end
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of its stubby tail it was fully twelve feet in length.  As it sighted
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the Sagoths it emitted a most frightful roar, and with open mouth
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: charged full upon them.  With a cry of terror the foremost gorilla-man
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: turned to escape, but behind him he ran full upon his on-rushing
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: companions.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The horror of the following seconds is indescribable.  The Sagoth
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: nearest the cave bear, finding his escape blocked, turned and leaped
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: deliberately to an awful death upon the jagged rocks three hundred feet
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: below.  Then those giant jaws reached out and gathered in the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: next--there was a sickening sound of crushing bones, and the mangled
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: corpse was dropped over the cliff's edge.  Nor did the mighty beast
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: even pause in his steady advance along the ledge.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Shrieking Sagoths were now leaping madly over the precipice to escape
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: him, and the last I saw he rounded the turn still pursuing the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: demoralized remnant of the man hunters.  For a long time I could hear
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the horrid roaring of the brute intermingled with the screams and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shrieks of his victims, until finally the awful sounds dwindled and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: disappeared in the distance.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Later I learned from Ghak, who had finally come to his tribesmen and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: returned with a party to rescue me, that the ryth, as it is called,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: pursued the Sagoths until it had exterminated the entire band.  Ghak
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was, of course, positive that I had fallen prey to the terrible
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: creature, which, within Pellucidar, is truly the king of beasts.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Not caring to venture back into the canyon, where I might fall prey
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: either to the cave bear or the Sagoths I continued on along the ledge,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: believing that by following around the mountain I could reach the land
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of Sari from another direction.  But I evidently became confused by the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: twisting and turning of the canyons and gullies, for I did not come to
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the land of Sari then, nor for a long time thereafter.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: XIV
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: THE GARDEN OF EDEN
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: With no heavenly guide, it is little wonder that I became confused and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lost in the labyrinthine maze of those mighty hills.  What, in reality,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I did was to pass entirely through them and come out above the valley
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon the farther side.  I know that I wandered for a long time, until
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: tired and hungry I came upon a small cave in the face of the limestone
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: formation which had taken the place of the granite farther back.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The cave which took my fancy lay halfway up the precipitous side of a
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lofty cliff.  The way to it was such that I knew no extremely
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: formidable beast could frequent it, nor was it large enough to make a
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: comfortable habitat for any but the smaller mammals or reptiles.  Yet
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: it was with the utmost caution that I crawled within its dark interior.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Here I found a rather large chamber, lighted by a narrow cleft in the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rock above which let the sunlight filter in in sufficient quantities
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: partially to dispel the utter darkness which I had expected.  The cave
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was entirely empty, nor were there any signs of its having been
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: recently occupied.  The opening was comparatively small, so that after
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: considerable effort I was able to lug up a bowlder from the valley
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: below which entirely blocked it.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Then I returned again to the valley for an armful of grasses and on
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: this trip was fortunate enough to knock over an orthopi, the diminutive
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: horse of Pellucidar, a little animal about the size of a fox terrier,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which abounds in all parts of the inner world.  Thus, with food and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: bedding I returned to my lair, where after a meal of raw meat, to which
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I had now become quite accustomed, I dragged the bowlder before the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: entrance and curled myself upon a bed of grasses--a naked, primeval,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cave man, as savagely primitive as my prehistoric progenitors.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I awoke rested but hungry, and pushing the bowlder aside crawled out
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon the little rocky shelf which was my front porch.  Before me spread
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a small but beautiful valley, through the center of which a clear and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sparkling river wound its way down to an inland sea, the blue waters of
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which were just visible between the two mountain ranges which embraced
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: this little paradise.  The sides of the opposite hills were green with
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: verdure, for a great forest clothed them to the foot of the red and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: yellow and copper green of the towering crags which formed their
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: summit.  The valley itself was carpeted with a luxuriant grass, while
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: here and there patches of wild flowers made great splashes of vivid
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: color against the prevailing green.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Dotted over the face of the valley were little clusters of palmlike
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: trees--three or four together as a rule.  Beneath these stood antelope,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: while others grazed in the open, or wandered gracefully to a nearby
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ford to drink.  There were several species of this beautiful animal,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the most magnificent somewhat resembling the giant eland of Africa,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: except that their spiral horns form a complete curve backward over
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: their ears and then forward again beneath them, ending in sharp and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: formidable points some two feet before the face and above the eyes.  In
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: size they remind one of a pure bred Hereford bull, yet they are very
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: agile and fast.  The broad yellow bands that stripe the dark roan of
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: their coats made me take them for zebra when I first saw them.  All in
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: all they are handsome animals, and added the finishing touch to the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: strange and lovely landscape that spread before my new home.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I had determined to make the cave my headquarters, and with it as a
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: base make a systematic exploration of the surrounding country in search
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the land of Sari.  First I devoured the remainder of the carcass of
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the orthopi I had killed before my last sleep.  Then I hid the Great
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Secret in a deep niche at the back of my cave, rolled the bowlder
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: before my front door, and with bow, arrows, sword, and shield scrambled
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: down into the peaceful valley.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The grazing herds moved to one side as I passed through them, the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: little orthopi evincing the greatest wariness and galloping to safest
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: distances.  All the animals stopped feeding as I approached, and after
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: moving to what they considered a safe distance stood contemplating me
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with serious eyes and up-cocked ears.  Once one of the old bull
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: antelopes of the striped species lowered his head and bellowed
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: angrily--even taking a few steps in my direction, so that I thought he
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: meant to charge; but after I had passed, he resumed feeding as though
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: nothing had disturbed him.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Near the lower end of the valley I passed a number of tapirs, and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: across the river saw a great sadok, the enormous double-horned
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: progenitor of the modern rhinoceros.  At the valley's end the cliffs
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon the left ran out into the sea, so that to pass around them as I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: desired to do it was necessary to scale them in search of a ledge along
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which I might continue my journey.  Some fifty feet from the base I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: came upon a projection which formed a natural path along the face of
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the cliff, and this I followed out over the sea toward the cliff's end.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Here the ledge inclined rapidly upward toward the top of the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cliffs--the stratum which formed it evidently having been forced up at
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: this steep angle when the mountains behind it were born.  As I climbed
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: carefully up the ascent my attention suddenly was attracted aloft by
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the sound of strange hissing, and what resembled the flapping of wings.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: And at the first glance there broke upon my horrified vision the most
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: frightful thing I had seen even within Pellucidar.  It was a giant
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dragon such as is pictured in the legends and fairy tales of earth
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: folk.  Its huge body must have measured forty feet in length, while the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: bat-like wings that supported it in midair had a spread of fully
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: thirty.  Its gaping jaws were armed with long, sharp teeth, and its
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: claw equipped with horrible talons.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The hissing noise which had first attracted my attention was issuing
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: from its throat, and seemed to be directed at something beyond and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: below me which I could not see.  The ledge upon which I stood
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: terminated abruptly a few paces farther on, and as I reached the end I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: saw the cause of the reptile's agitation.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Some time in past ages an earthquake had produced a fault at this
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: point, so that beyond the spot where I stood the strata had slipped
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: down a matter of twenty feet.  The result was that the continuation of
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my ledge lay twenty feet below me, where it ended as abruptly as did
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the end upon which I stood.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: And here, evidently halted in flight by this insurmountable break in
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the ledge, stood the object of the creature's attack--a girl cowering
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon the narrow platform, her face buried in her arms, as though to
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shut out the sight of the frightful death which hovered just above her.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The dragon was circling lower, and seemed about to dart in upon its
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: prey.  There was no time to be lost, scarce an instant in which to
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: weigh the possible chances that I had against the awfully armed
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: creature; but the sight of that frightened girl below me called out to
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: all that was best in me, and the instinct for protection of the other
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sex, which nearly must have equaled the instinct of self-preservation
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in primeval man, drew me to the girl's side like an irresistible magnet.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Almost thoughtless of the consequences, I leaped from the end of the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ledge upon which I stood, for the tiny shelf twenty feet below.  At the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: same instant the dragon darted in toward the girl, but my sudden advent
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon the scene must have startled him for he veered to one side, and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: then rose above us once more.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The noise I made as I landed beside her convinced the girl that the end
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had come, for she thought I was the dragon; but finally when no cruel
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fangs closed upon her she raised her eyes in astonishment.  As they
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fell upon me the expression that came into them would be difficult to
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: describe; but her feelings could scarcely have been one whit more
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: complicated than my own--for the wide eyes that looked into mine were
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: those of Dian the Beautiful.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Dian!" I cried.  "Dian!  Thank God that I came in time."
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "You?" she whispered, and then she hid her face again; nor could I tell
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: whether she were glad or angry that I had come.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Once more the dragon was sweeping toward us, and so rapidly that I had
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: no time to unsling my bow.  All that I could do was to snatch up a
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rock, and hurl it at the thing's hideous face.  Again my aim was true,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and with a hiss of pain and rage the reptile wheeled once more and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: soared away.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Quickly I fitted an arrow now that I might be ready at the next attack,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and as I did so I looked down at the girl, so that I surprised her in a
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: surreptitious glance which she was stealing at me; but immediately, she
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: again covered her face with her hands.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Look at me, Dian," I pleaded.  "Are you not glad to see me?"
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: She looked straight into my eyes.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I hate you," she said, and then, as I was about to beg for a fair
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hearing she pointed over my shoulder.  "The thipdar comes," she said,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and I turned again to meet the reptile.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: So this was a thipdar.  I might have known it.  The cruel bloodhound of
title: At the Earth's Core

text: the Mahars.  The long-extinct pterodactyl of the outer world.  But this

text: time I met it with a weapon it never had faced before.  I had selected

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core

text: tough breast.

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fell turning and twisting into the sea below, my arrow buried
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: completely in its carcass.  I turned toward the girl.  She was looking
title: At the Earth's Core

text: past me.  It was evident that she had seen the thipdar die.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core

title: At the Earth's Core

title: At the Earth's Core

text: vehemence in it than before--yet it might have been but my imagination.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Why do you hate me, Dian?" I asked, but she did not answer me.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At first I thought that she was going to ignore me entirely, but
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: finally she thought better of it.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I was again running away from Jubal the Ugly One," she said.  "After I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: escaped from the Sagoths I made my way alone back to my own land; but
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: on account of Jubal I did not dare enter the villages or let any of my
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: By watching for a long time I found that my brother had not yet
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: returned, and so I continued to live in a cave beside a valley which my
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: race seldom frequents, awaiting the time that he should come back and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: free me from Jubal.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "But at last one of Jubal's hunters saw me as I was creeping toward my
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: father's cave to see if my brother had yet returned and he gave the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: alarm and Jubal set out after me.  He has been pursuing me across many
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lands.  He cannot be far behind me now.  When he comes he will kill you
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and carry me back to his cave.  He is a terrible man.  I have gone as
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: far as I can go, and there is no escape," and she looked hopelessly up
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: at the continuation of the ledge twenty feet above us.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "But he shall not have me," she suddenly cried, with great vehemence.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "The sea is there"--she pointed over the edge of the cliff--"and the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sea shall have me rather than Jubal."
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "But I have you now Dian," I cried; "nor shall Jubal, nor any other
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: have you, for you are mine," and I seized her hand, nor did I lift it
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: She had risen to her feet, and was looking straight into my eyes with
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: level gaze.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I do not believe you," she said, "for if you meant it you would have
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: done this when the others were present to witness it--then I should
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: truly have been your mate; now there is no one to see you do it, for
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: you know that without witnesses your act does not bind you to me," and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: she withdrew her hand from mine and turned away.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I tried to convince her that I was sincere, but she simply couldn't
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: forget the humiliation that I had put upon her on that other occasion.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "If you mean all that you say you will have ample chance to prove it,"
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: she said, "if Jubal does not catch and kill you.  I am in your power,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and the treatment you accord me will be the best proof of your
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: intentions toward me.  I am not your mate, and again I tell you that I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hate you, and that I should be glad if I never saw you again."
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Dian certainly was candid.  There was no gainsaying that.  In fact I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: found candor and directness to be quite a marked characteristic of the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cave men of Pellucidar.  Finally I suggested that we make some attempt
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to gain my cave, where we might escape the searching Jubal, for I am
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: free to admit that I had no considerable desire to meet the formidable
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and ferocious creature, of whose mighty prowess Dian had told me when I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: first met her.  He it was who, armed with a puny knife, had met and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: killed a cave bear in a hand-to-hand struggle.  It was Jubal who could
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cast his spear entirely through the armored carcass of the sadok at
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fifty paces.  It was he who had crushed the skull of a charging dyryth
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with a single blow of his war club.  No, I was not pining to meet the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Ugly One-and it was quite certain that I should not go out and hunt for
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: him; but the matter was taken out of my hands very quickly, as is often
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the way, and I did meet Jubal the Ugly One face to face.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: This is how it happened.  I had led Dian back along the ledge the way
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: she had come, searching for a path that would lead us to the top of the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cliff, for I knew that we could then cross over to the edge of my own
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: little valley, where I felt certain we should find a means of ingress
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: from the cliff top.  As we proceeded along the ledge I gave Dian minute
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: directions for finding my cave against the chance of something
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: happening to me.  I knew that she would be quite safely hidden away
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: from pursuit once she gained the shelter of my lair, and the valley
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: would afford her ample means of sustenance.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Also, I was very much piqued by her treatment of me.  My heart was sad
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and heavy, and I wanted to make her feel badly by suggesting that
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: something terrible might happen to me--that I might, in fact, be
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: killed.  But it didn't work worth a cent, at least as far as I could
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: perceive.  Dian simply shrugged those magnificent shoulders of hers,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and murmured something to the effect that one was not rid of trouble so
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: easily as that.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: For a while I kept still.  I was utterly squelched.  And to think that
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I had twice protected her from attack--the last time risking my life to
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: save hers.  It was incredible that even a daughter of the Stone Age
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: could be so ungrateful--so heartless; but maybe her heart partook of
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the qualities of her epoch.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Presently we found a rift in the cliff which had been widened and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: extended by the action of the water draining through it from the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: plateau above.  It gave us a rather rough climb to the summit, but
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: finally we stood upon the level mesa which stretched back for several
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: miles to the mountain range.  Behind us lay the broad inland sea,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: curving upward in the horizonless distance to merge into the blue of
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the sky, so that for all the world it looked as though the sea lapped
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: back to arch completely over us and disappear beyond the distant
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mountains at our backs--the weird and uncanny aspect of the seascapes
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of Pellucidar balk description.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At our right lay a dense forest, but to the left the country was open
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and clear to the plateau's farther verge.  It was in this direction
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that our way led, and we had turned to resume our journey when Dian
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: touched my arm.  I turned to her, thinking that she was about to make
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: peace overtures; but I was mistaken.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Jubal," she said, and nodded toward the forest.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I looked, and there, emerging from the dense wood, came a perfect whale
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of a man.  He must have been seven feet tall, and proportioned
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: accordingly.  He still was too far off to distinguish his features.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Run," I said to Dian.  "I can engage him until you get a good start.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Maybe I can hold him until you have gotten entirely away," and then,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: without a backward glance, I advanced to meet the Ugly One.  I had
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hoped that Dian would have a kind word to say to me before she went,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for she must have known that I was going to my death for her sake; but
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: she never even so much as bid me good-bye, and it was with a heavy
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: heart that I strode through the flower-bespangled grass to my doom.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: When I had come close enough to Jubal to distinguish his features I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: understood how it was that he had earned the sobriquet of Ugly One.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Apparently some fearful beast had ripped away one entire side of his
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: face.  The eye was gone, the nose, and all the flesh, so that his jaws
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and all his teeth were exposed and grinning through the horrible scar.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Formerly he may have been as good to look upon as the others of his
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: handsome race, and it may be that the terrible result of this encounter
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had tended to sour an already strong and brutal character.  However
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: this may be it is quite certain that he was not a pretty sight, and now
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that his features, or what remained of them, were distorted in rage at
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the sight of Dian with another male, he was indeed most terrible to
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: see--and much more terrible to meet.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He had broken into a run now, and as he advanced he raised his mighty
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: spear, while I halted and fitting an arrow to my bow took as steady aim
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: as I could.  I was somewhat longer than usual, for I must confess that
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the sight of this awful man had wrought upon my nerves to such an
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: extent that my knees were anything but steady.  What chance had I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: against this mighty warrior for whom even the fiercest cave bear had no
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: terrors!  Could I hope to best one who slaughtered the sadok and dyryth
