author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: single-handed!  I shuddered; but, in fairness to myself, my fear was
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: more for Dian than for my own fate.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: And then the great brute launched his massive stone-tipped spear, and I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: raised my shield to break the force of its terrific velocity.  The
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: impact hurled me to my knees, but the shield had deflected the missile
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and I was unscathed.  Jubal was rushing upon me now with the only
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: remaining weapon that he carried--a murderous-looking knife.  He was
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: too close for a careful bowshot, but I let drive at him as he came,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: without taking aim.  My arrow pierced the fleshy part of his thigh,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: inflicting a painful but not disabling wound.  And then he was upon me.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: My agility saved me for the instant.  I ducked beneath his raised arm,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and when he wheeled to come at me again he found a sword's point in his
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: face.  And a moment later he felt an inch or two of it in the muscles
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of his knife arm, so that thereafter he went more warily.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It was a duel of strategy now--the great, hairy man maneuvering to get
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: inside my guard where he could bring those giant thews to play, while
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my wits were directed to the task of keeping him at arm's length.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Thrice he rushed me, and thrice I caught his knife blow upon my shield.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Each time my sword found his body--once penetrating to his lung.  He
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was covered with blood by this time, and the internal hemorrhage
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: induced paroxysms of coughing that brought the red stream through the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hideous mouth and nose, covering his face and breast with bloody froth.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He was a most unlovely spectacle, but he was far from dead.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As the duel continued I began to gain confidence, for, to be perfectly
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: candid, I had not expected to survive the first rush of that monstrous
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: engine of ungoverned rage and hatred.  And I think that Jubal, from
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: utter contempt of me, began to change to a feeling of respect, and then
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in his primitive mind there evidently loomed the thought that perhaps
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: at last he had met his master, and was facing his end.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At any rate it is only upon this hypothesis that I can account for his
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: next act, which was in the nature of a last resort--a sort of forlorn
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hope, which could only have been born of the belief that if he did not
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: kill me quickly I should kill him.  It happened on the occasion of his
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fourth charge, when, instead of striking at me with his knife, he
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dropped that weapon, and seizing my sword blade in both his hands
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: wrenched the weapon from my grasp as easily as from a babe.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Flinging it far to one side he stood motionless for just an instant
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: glaring into my face with such a horrid leer of malignant triumph as to
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: almost unnerve me--then he sprang for me with his bare hands.  But it
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was Jubal's day to learn new methods of warfare.  For the first time he
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had seen a bow and arrows, never before that duel had he beheld a
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sword, and now he learned what a man who knows may do with his bare
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fists.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As he came for me, like a great bear, I ducked again beneath his
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: outstretched arm, and as I came up planted as clean a blow upon his jaw
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: as ever you have seen.  Down went that great mountain of flesh
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sprawling upon the ground.  He was so surprised and dazed that he lay
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: there for several seconds before he made any attempt to rise, and I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: stood over him with another dose ready when he should gain his knees.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Up he came at last, almost roaring in his rage and mortification; but
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: he didn't stay up--I let him have a left fair on the point of the jaw

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that sent him tumbling over on his back.  By this time I think Jubal
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had gone mad with hate, for no sane man would have come back for more
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: as many times as he did.  Time after time I bowled him over as fast as
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: he could stagger up, until toward the last he lay longer on the ground
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: between blows, and each time came up weaker than before.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He was bleeding very profusely now from the wound in his lungs, and
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: presently a terrific blow over the heart sent him reeling heavily to
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the ground, where he lay very still, and somehow I knew at once that
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Jubal the Ugly One would never get up again.  But even as I looked upon
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that massive body lying there so grim and terrible in death, I could
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: not believe that I, single-handed, had bested this slayer of fearful
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: beasts--this gigantic ogre of the Stone Age.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Picking up my sword I leaned upon it, looking down on the dead body of
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my foeman, and as I thought of the battle I had just fought and won a
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that Perry had made within the city of Phutra.  If skill and science

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: could render a comparative pygmy the master of this mighty brute, what

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: their king and Dian their queen.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Dian!  A little wave of doubt swept over me.  It was quite within the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: possibilities of Dian to look down upon me even were I king.  She was
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: quite the most superior person I ever had met--with the most convincing
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: way of letting you know that she was superior.  Well, I could go to the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cave, and tell her that I had killed Jubal, and then she might feel
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: more kindly toward me, since I had freed her of her tormentor.  I hoped

text: and defense.  As soon as I was able to be about again, I sought out

title: At the Earth's Core

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core

title: At the Earth's Core

title: At the Earth's Core

title: At the Earth's Core

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core

title: At the Earth's Core

title: At the Earth's Core

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core

text: mate.

title: At the Earth's Core

title: At the Earth's Core

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: be one great overlord, or emperor.  It was decided that I should be the
title: At the Earth's Core

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core

title: At the Earth's Core

title: At the Earth's Core

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: us alive, and at the same time had threatened to inflict the direst
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: understand these seemingly paradoxical instructions, though their
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: At the Earth's Core

text: feet."

text: which covered her since the Mahar prisoners had been brought into camp.
title: At the Earth's Core

text: He deposited his burden in the seat beside me.  I was all ready to get
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: under way.  The good-byes had been said.  Perry had grasped my hand in
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the last, long farewell.  I closed and barred the outer and inner
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: doors, took my seat again at the driving mechanism, and pulled the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: starting lever.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As before on that far-gone night that had witnessed our first trial of
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the iron monster, there was a frightful roaring beneath us--the giant
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: frame trembled and vibrated--there was a rush of sound as the loose
title: At the Earth's Core

text: earth passed up through the hollow space between the inner and outer
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: jackets to be deposited in our wake.  Once more the thing was off.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: But on the instant of departure I was nearly thrown from my seat by the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sudden lurching of the prospector.  At first I did not realize what had
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: happened, but presently it dawned upon me that just before entering the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: crust the towering body had fallen through its supporting scaffolding,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and that instead of entering the ground vertically we were plunging
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: into it at a different angle.  Where it would bring us out upon the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upper crust I could not even conjecture.  And then I turned to note the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: effect of this strange experience upon Dian.  She still sat shrouded in
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the great skin.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Come, come," I cried, laughing, "come out of your shell.  No Mahar
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: eyes can reach you here," and I leaned over and snatched the lion skin
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: from her.  And then I shrank back upon my seat in utter horror.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The thing beneath the skin was not Dian--it was a hideous Mahar.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Instantly I realized the trick that Hooja had played upon me, and the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: purpose of it.  Rid of me, forever as he doubtless thought, Dian would
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: be at his mercy.  Frantically I tore at the steering wheel in an effort
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to turn the prospector back toward Pellucidar; but, as on that other
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: occasion, I could not budge the thing a hair.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It is needless to recount the horrors or the monotony of that journey.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It varied but little from the former one which had brought us from the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: outer to the inner world.  Because of the angle at which we had entered
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the ground the trip required nearly a day longer, and brought me out
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: here upon the sand of the Sahara instead of in the United States as I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had hoped.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: For months I have been waiting here for a white man to come.  I dared
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: not leave the prospector for fear I should never be able to find it
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: again--the shifting sands of the desert would soon cover it, and then
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my only hope of returning to my Dian and her Pellucidar would be gone
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: forever.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: That I ever shall see her again seems but remotely possible, for how
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: may I know upon what part of Pellucidar my return journey may
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: terminate--and how, without a north or south or an east or a west may I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hope ever to find my way across that vast world to the tiny spot where
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my lost love lies grieving for me?
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: That is the story as David Innes told it to me in the goat-skin tent
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon the rim of the great Sahara Desert.  The next day he took me out
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to see the prospector--it was precisely as he had described it.  So
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: huge was it that it could have been brought to this inaccessible part
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the world by no means of transportation that existed there--it could
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: only have come in the way that David Innes said it came--up through the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: crust of the earth from the inner world of Pellucidar.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I spent a week with him, and then, abandoned my lion hunt, returned
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: directly to the coast and hurried to London where I purchased a great
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: quantity of stuff which he wished to take back to Pellucidar with him.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: There were books, rifles, revolvers, ammunition, cameras, chemicals,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: telephones, telegraph instruments, wire, tool and more books--books
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon every subject under the sun.  He said he wanted a library with
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which they could reproduce the wonders of the twentieth century in the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Stone Age and if quantity counts for anything I got it for him.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I took the things back to Algeria myself, and accompanied them to the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: end of the railroad; but from here I was recalled to America upon
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: important business.  However, I was able to employ a very trustworthy
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: man to take charge of the caravan--the same guide, in fact, who had
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: accompanied me on the previous trip into the Sahara--and after writing
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a long letter to Innes in which I gave him my American address, I saw
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the expedition head south.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Among the other things which I sent to Innes was over five hundred
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: miles of double, insulated wire of a very fine gauge.  I had it packed
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: on a special reel at his suggestion, as it was his idea that he could
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fasten one end here before he left and by paying it out through the end
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the prospector lay a telegraph line between the outer and inner
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: worlds.  In my letter I told him to be sure to mark the terminus of the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: line very plainly with a high cairn, in case I was not able to reach
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: him before he set out, so that I might easily find and communicate with
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: him should he be so fortunate as to reach Pellucidar.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I received several letters from him after I returned to America--in
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fact he took advantage of every northward-passing caravan to drop me
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: word of some sort.  His last letter was written the day before he
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: intended to depart.  Here it is.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: My Dear Friend:
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Tomorrow I shall set out in quest of Pellucidar and Dian. That is
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: if the Arabs don't get me. They have been very nasty of late. I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: don't know the cause, but on two occasions they have threatened my
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: life. One, more friendly than the rest, told me today that they
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: intended attacking me tonight. It would be unfortunate should
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: anything of that sort happen now that I am so nearly ready to
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: depart.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: However, maybe I will be as well off, for the nearer the hour
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: approaches, the slenderer my chances for success appear.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Here is the friendly Arab who is to take this letter north for me,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: so good-bye, and God bless you for your kindness to me.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The Arab tells me to hurry, for he sees a cloud of sand to the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: south--he thinks it is the party coming to murder me, and he
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: doesn't want to be found with me. So good-bye again.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Yours,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: David Innes.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: A year later found me at the end of the railroad once more, headed for
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the spot where I had left Innes.  My first disappointment was when I
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: discovered that my old guide had died within a few weeks of my return,
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: nor could I find any member of my former party who could lead me to the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: same spot.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: For months I searched that scorching land, interviewing countless
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: desert sheiks in the hope that at last I might find one who had heard
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of Innes and his wonderful iron mole.  Constantly my eyes scanned the
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: blinding waste of sand for the ricky cairn beneath which I was to find
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the wires leading to Pellucidar--but always was I unsuccessful.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: And always do these awful questions harass me when I think of David
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Innes and his strange adventures.
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Did the Arabs murder him, after all, just on the eve of his departure?
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Or, did he again turn the nose of his iron monster toward the inner
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: world?  Did he reach it, or lies he somewhere buried in the heart of
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the great crust?  And if he did come again to Pellucidar was it to
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: break through into the bottom of one of her great island seas, or among
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: some savage race far, far from the land of his heart's desire?
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Does the answer lie somewhere upon the bosom of the broad Sahara, at
title: At the Earth's Core
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the end of two tiny wires, hidden beneath a lost cairn?  I wonder.
